Package Controllers

Class MineSweeperController

java.lang.Object
Controllers.MineSweeperController
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class MineSweeperController extends Object implements Serializable
This class stores the controller for the Minesweeper game. The controller's responsibility is to organize the updating of a board according to user inputs, and to relay information to and from the model, especially for the purpose of save/load functionality and checking whether the game is over.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • MineSweeperController

      public MineSweeperController(String difficulty)
      Constructor for the controller. When initialized, the controller immediately creates a new board with the size and mine density appropriate for the selected difficulty.
      Parameters:
      difficulty - A string representing the difficulty of the game, which affects board size and mine density.

    • MineSweeperController

      public MineSweeperController(File savedController) throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Constructs a controller from a saved file.
      Parameters:
      savedController - The file in which the saved game is stored.
      Throws:
      IOException - If file loading failed.
      ClassNotFoundException - If a MineSweeperTile[][] could not be loaded from the file information.

  • Method Details

    • updateTileStatus

      public void updateTileStatus(int row, int col, GUESS_STATUS status)
      This method determines the current status of the clicked tile, and based on the status parameter, assigns a new status to the tile.
      Parameters:
      row - is the y coord of the tile
      col - is the x coord of the tile
      status - is an enum either GUESSED or FLAGGED, depending on the mouse button clicked.

    • updateTilesAround

      public void updateTilesAround(int row, int col)
      When the user clicks a tile, this method updates all of the tiles around it.
      Parameters:
      row - The row of the tile to update around.
      col - The column of the tile to update around.

    • setObserver

      public void setObserver(Observer o)
      Adds an observer to the model's observer list.
      Parameters:
      o - The observer to be added. Most likely a view object.

    • saveGame

      public void saveGame(File f) throws IOException
      Saves the game by outputting the current state of the board and the instance variables to a file.
      Parameters:
      f - - the file to save the game into
      Throws:
      IOException - If the game fails to save.

    • loadGame

      public void loadGame(File f) throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Loads the game by reading off parameters from the Controller object stored in the chosen file.
      Parameters:
      f - - the file to read the game from
      Throws:
      IOException - If opening the file fails
      ClassNotFoundException - If the object we try to load is not a valid MineSweeperTile[][]

    • createTimer

      public void createTimer(Runnable updater)
      This passes the timer creation onto the model
      Parameters:
      updater - - the runnable to be called upon updates to the timer

    • shutdownTimer

      public void shutdownTimer()
      This kills the timer executor so that it is no longer running. This allows us to either create a new executor for a new game, or we can exit the program

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      Checks if the game is over
      Returns:
      true if the game is over, false if we are still playing

    • gameIsOver

      public void gameIsOver()
      Sets gameOver to true and calls the model's notify method.

    • win

      public boolean win()
      Checks if the user won
      Returns:
      true if the user won, false if they lost

    • getBoard

      public MineSweeperTile[][] getBoard()
      Gets the current board for this game
      Returns:
      The MineSweeperTile[][] array from this controller's current model.

    • getSecondsElapsed

      public double getSecondsElapsed()
      When called, this method updates the model's time by some number of milliseconds and returns the new time.
      Returns:
      The number of seconds that the current game has been going for, as a double.

    • getTopTimes

      public String[] getTopTimes()
      Retrieves the top times from the scoreboard for this game's difficulty.
      Returns:
      - a string representing the top times

    • getRows

      public int getRows()
      Gets the rows of the current board
      Returns:
      The number of rows in the model's grid.

    • getCols

      public int getCols()
      Gets the cols of the current board
      Returns:
      The number of columns in the model's grid.

    • disableTimer

      public void disableTimer()
      This disables the models timer (handled in the model)

    • enableTimer

      public void enableTimer()
      This enables the models timer (handled in the model)

    • isGamePaused

      public boolean isGamePaused()
      This checks if the game is paused by determining if the model's timer is equal to 0 (not incrememing)
      Returns:
      true if the game is paused

    • getMineCount

      public String getMineCount()
      Gets a nice string in the form of "CURRENT/TOTAL" for the number of flags places and mines
      Returns:
      A string representation of the number of flags and mines on the board

    • getBombCount

      public int getBombCount()
      Returns how many bombs are on the current board
      Returns:
      The number of bombs on the current board
